metadata.abstract: Â© 2022 The Author(s). Published by Oxford University Press.Predicting orthologs, genes in different species having shared ancestry, is an important task in bioinformatics. Orthology prediction agents are required to make accurate and fast predictions, in order to analyze large amounts of data within a feasible time frame. InParanoid is a well-known algorithm for orthology analysis, shown to perform well in benchmarks, but having the major limitation of long runtimes on large datasets. Here, we present an update to the InParanoid algorithm that can use the faster agent DIAMOND instead of BLAST for the homolog search step. We show that it reduces the runtime by 94%, while still obtaining similar performance in the Quest for Orthologs benchmark.
metadata.title: InParanoid-DIAMOND: Faster orthology analysis with the InParanoid algorithm
